website_summaries.verdict: This steel slat replacement is stronger than wooden slats and can serve as a firm alternative to a box spring.
pros: Easy to assemble comes with good instructions
Can flatten out a sagging mattress
Easier to handle than a box spring
cons: Slats are not very close together and not adjustable
The metal can be a little slick for the mattress

customer_reviews.title: Quality frame, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Glad I got this instead of something Swedish. Very sturdy, super easy instructions and easy assembly. Make sure you get some 1-2 inch foam tape if you are using this with a metal bed frame, the two frames make some noise if you move around or have recreational activities. One I applied some foam tape, it's super quiet. I also used some zip ties to hold the 2 frames together. Very good product, highly recommended, you can tell there was thought put in and they cared about making something that wasn't junk.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Assembled in no time.
customer_reviews.text: Assembled quickly and easily, feels quite sturdy. I'm now realizing my problem wasn't my old slats, it's my bed itself that's creaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lynn Kauffman

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend avoiding unless they enjoy paying new prices for used ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased what was billed as a "new" item. What I received was anything but. The package had clearly been opened previously and crudely re-taped with black duct tape, which didn't stick out at all. The frame itself was chipped and dented on every piece I took out and examined. Very disappointing to say the least. I would recommend avoiding unless they enjoy paying new prices for used or returned inventory.
customer_reviews.author: david seelig

customer_reviews.title: No more sagging!
customer_reviews.text: I thought for-sure we needed to replace our mattress. It was sagging and we ended up with a bit of a "hump" in the middle between my wife and I. The wooden slats weren't helping so to reduce creaking and hold us over I decided to give this a shot. It went together very easily (I used thread locker/ felt strips that did not come with the kit) and after getting the mattress back on, the hump was gone! The 1/4" wooden slats were bowing! Our mattress was actually fine which is great! Going to get a full size one to replace the one in my daughter's room next!
customer_reviews.author: Goonie

customer_reviews.title: Made all the difference with mattress sagging and collapsing edges
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend! Made all the difference in the comfort of our mattress. We really didn't realize how unsupportive our boxspring was for our new luxury and very heavy new mattress. Even though we bought the boxspring with our mattress it just wasn't firm enough and our mattress had to be turned every 3 weeks or so because of sagging. This made all the difference. The edges don't collapse anymore, the sagging has stopped and the whole bed is so much more stable.
customer_reviews.author: LBK

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase along with glideway. For Heavier individuals!
customer_reviews.text: Check bed measurements my king size bed allowed the bunkie board to fit with room to slide left to right. While that's ok my side rails support came close to not extending out far enough to support the bunkie board. Once the mattress was on it was no movement. Now I also used additional items for support I used the glideway metal support then i put the bunkie board, i also put my box spring on (so the bed would sit up high) then my mattress. Its working out really well. Holds our weight and you dont hear any creaking or movement.
customer_reviews.author: James Givens Jr

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to lower our bed because my wife developed some health issues that made it difficult to comfortably get in and out of our bed. I bought this Bunkie Board hoping that it would allow me to lower the bed several inches. I easily assembled the Bunkie Board...it took me about 15 minutes...removed the existing box spring and replaced it with the Bunkie Board (it fit perfectly); and then laid the regular mattress on top. It worked perfectly! Bed was immediately several inches lower. This product is very well made; easy to assemble; and is a very inexpensive way to safely lower the height of the bed. I would absolutely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Bosco Bob

customer_reviews.title: This is the ONLY product you need to buy
customer_reviews.text: I dreaded putting this thing together in my tiny studio apartment but I was pleasantly surprised how simple and quick it was to put this together. Well, not quick, but not complicated once you get going. What really made this easy were the instructions and that each joint was labeled with a number of coinciding parts. So you would put #3 on this bar with the #3 on another bar and connect them, screw in the bolt and move on. I think it was about 8 steps in all. great quality, heavy, durable metal. i got this for my purple bed which is super heavy. this platform doesn't shift or creak or anything. absolutely satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: MyNameYeff

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Support
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to assemble and does the job. It added support me and my wife needed since our bed frame came with huge gaps and no slats. We also paired this with the Zinus fabic covered wooden slats to put on top for even more support since the metal isn't really metal and will probably bend over time. I would recommend zip tieing the bunkie board to your bed frame so it does not slide around since the king doesn't exactly fit a king size bed frame. Overall I enjoy the product for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: It works... but not great.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say... it sure does keep your bed sturdy, you can probably put a elephant on your bed and it will stay. now with the cons.... It is CRAZY loud. NOT recommended for a active couple... it brings your bed up a 1/2 to 1’ which is noticeable... it changes the way you sleep... I honestly think the extra stiffness really changed things... only had it for about 3 nights and my back kinda hurts... the warranty says only good if using box springs which we are... but man does it make my 3k mattress kinda stiff... I honestly would have went to something else... I can’t get past how loud it is..
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Had been using the wood/cardboard fabric covered bunkie board on my king platform bed for years. Finally got fed up with noise (LOUD) whenever someone got on or off the bed or simply turned. Took a chance and ordered this. Was a little hesitate because it wasn't solid. Received the day after I ordered it and it took me all of 15 minutes to assemble. I did break up the styrofoam packing bars and stuffed along the top and bottom edges so it would be snug in the frame. NO NOISE LAST NIGHT!!!! Couldn't be more pleased. The price is right on point compared to the solid bunkie boards too!
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: So far do good alot better than box springs
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together, I have a long size bed I'm using this instead of the 20 yr old box springs that squeaked everytime u moved. I do believe I need extra screws from a hardware store to actually hold on to head board BC the way my bed it made it does move a few inches from head board to foot board but it doesnt bother me any.... and no more squeaky noises anymore... works for people that are "active" in bed lol.... have had for about 2 weeks do far will update again in a month... Oh yea other reviews said they were missing parts. I had those extra and tools to use at well.
customer_reviews.author: e1987

customer_reviews.title: From a queen to a king - add plywood if using memory foam
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to put a king mattress on a queen frame. They provided a hex ratchet wrench (love) which made it quick and easy to put together. Added some plywood, since the spacing is too far apart for a memory foam mattress, and we were good to go. If you were going to use a box spring, then it would work as is.
customer_reviews.author: Ceci M

customer_reviews.title: Get rid of your old, noisy box spring
customer_reviews.text: Just an awesome box replacement. My bed is low and normal height, plus no longer noisy. Had to add some reinforcement pieces of thick fabric (nonslip rug fabric) where the metal frame meets the bed frame to keep it from sliding and to square the Gulzar. The sticky tape on the four Gulzar rods are not really useful, but a good idea. Love this thing. My 16” mattress no longer feels like I’m on the Empire State Building.
customer_reviews.author: Joel C

customer_reviews.title: A King frame review
customer_reviews.text: It a sturdy frame, easy to assemble, little bit small though for my Ikea Malm bed. When I completely shifted this frame to one side of my bed it would not rest on the frame support on the other side. I solved it with a couple of wooden slats on both sides of the metal frame. Now it does not slide off the support any more. The frame as said sturdy build, powder coated , does not make noise and some spare screws and a ratchet came with it. Let my comment above not discourage you, it can be solved easy.
customer_reviews.author: Robbert

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: By far the easiest furniture assembly I have ever done. I am pretty handy, but this was so easy - the components were packaged beautifully, and I cannot rave enough about the details included. The ratchet included made installation so fast, but they also included at traditional Allen wrench for those who prefer that way (aka my husband). Time will tell how it holds up, but so far I have nothing but positives to say.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: SIZE doesn’t even FIT
customer_reviews.text: I have a king size frame that I BOUGHT from Zinus. I then bought a king sized bunky. After putting it all together, turns out the bunky is a size bigger than my freaking king size bed frame. WTF are you guys thinking? Now I have to unscrew and put together everything back some how and turn it into a heavy piece of metal with tape just wrapped all over it and send it right back.
customer_reviews.author: chadwick ii

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived super quickly and was very easy to assemble (I did use a rubber mallet to tap the ends together, but assembly was very easy). This made the bed very comfortable. I purchased the product because I felt that our box spring and foam mattress were sagging on the metal bed frame with just a single center support. The bunkie fixed the sag and made the mattress super comfortable. What I didn't expect was that I have woken up the past few days with zero back/joint pain.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi O

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality, Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we wanted , delivered within a very fast time frame. We purchased a new bed, which contrary to the information we were given, did not come with the proper frame base for a memory foam mattress. After calls to several area stores for an in-stock king size bunke board, I saw this on Amazon. We are thrilled with our purchase! Not only were we able to get it faster and cheaper, the quality far surpasses the typical bunke board.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I was debating if I should purchase this item. My bed frame measures 81 in width and the product here stated it was 75.5. So I was hoping it wouldnt be too small... but it's actually a perfect fit. It has a slight gap on both ends but still fits where it should be. . It's very sturdy. Last night was my first time sleeping on it and it was great. It does slide a bit with the bed so that would be the only negative but it does what its supposed to; lots of support!
customer_reviews.author: Lis G.

customer_reviews.title: Simple to assemble
customer_reviews.text: OMG, this thing was so dang easy to put together, I couldn't believe it!! It was delivered while my husband was at church so I did it all by myself, no big deal. The slates went in very easily and fits great. We have not slept on it yet but we'll see tonight. I read another review that said it was good to use foam tape between the metal rails and the bunkie board rail which made sense. Since I didn't have foam tape, I sliced the foam that came inside the cardboard box into thin strips and placed them along the sides, seems like it will work good.
customer_reviews.author: blkdogs2

customer_reviews.title: Frame snapped like a twig three days after it was installed.
customer_reviews.text: Both my wife and I weigh a total of 300 pounds combined. The frame snapped as we were laying in bed with our 2 week old newborn baby. Thankfully no one was hurt. Highly unsatisfied and would never recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT! We bought it because we got rid of the box springs on our bed. They made the bed too high. Not only was this super easy to put together but it fixed the problems we had with our memory foam mattress! It is much more comfortable with no "dips" in it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Pinderella

customer_reviews.title: It’s sturdy but has flaws I haven’t found anything better tho for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfect in my frame. Wish I didn’t put the tape on it tho. So annoying when trying to make the bed or put a cover on it. It’s starting to squeak now as well and I don’t even sleep on it often. Going to be a pain taking off the mattresses and trying to put some padding on the squeaking parts. Pay attention to every detail when you put it together. It’s easy but only if you follow every step.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, great product, fast shipping, heavy-duty quality and most of all very easy to assemble. It was so nice to wake up in the morning without having my face to the ceiling! Don't miss those box springs that we had! Why did I wait 15 years to do this, I don't know...also it did nice not have to use a footstool in order to climb into my bed anymore! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: MCW

customer_reviews.title: Product is too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: This does not work good for a king size bed. The distance is too great for the thickness of the frame. It bounces and sacks in the middle. I ended up having to cut 2x4's and placing them in the middle for support. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Assembly,  Strong and Sturdy with Minimal Height
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a platform bed for the 1st time and I was concerned that the bed frame's existing support would not provide sufficient support for the mattress. After looking at several Bunkie Board and Foundation options, I decided on this item. Assembly instruction are very straightforward and assembly is a breeze. My only complaint is that the Allen Wrench screws holding all the frame pieces together are easy to strip, but the assembly comes with two extra screws. The assembly fits nicely on top of the existing frame support for my platform bed and it provides the extra stability that I was hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Lowther

customer_reviews.title: Best one on the marketplace!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Arrived on time. Packaged very well, metals did not have even a scratch. Instructions and labeling were superb, dimensions perfect, it fit to the bed frame perfectly. Extremely well designed and made, sturdy. Best product on the marketplace.
customer_reviews.author: Bmb

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly into metal frame
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the king size assembly and it fits perfectly into my existing metal bed frame. Parts were brand new as described and the undamaged box was delivered by 2 people. Great experience
customer_reviews.author: T. Huynh

customer_reviews.title: The perfect fit.
customer_reviews.text: We originally have a zinus memory foam mattress, we loved it so much that we bought this product to help support the mattress with a new set of furniture we bought. BY FAR the easiest to assemble. Loved it. Super quick, painless. And by looking at it you know it's stable. We love how we sleep now on it and feel good knowing we don't need a bully box spring to do the job. I highly recommend this product for those who need support like a box spring. Less space, less time, and much cheaper. Yay! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Claire Garner

customer_reviews.title: Super disappointed - too small
customer_reviews.text: This did not fit our king size bed frame. I was so excited and read all the reviews and researched a ton. It was about 1 inch or maybe 1/2inch too short (width wise).
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Leedy

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, works great!
customer_reviews.text: After buying a bed online that stated "no box spring needed," when it arrived it clearly didn't have the slats to support a new memory foam hybrid mattress set to arrive in 2 days. I had never heard of a bunkie board, but some quick research led me to this amazing solution! It arrived before the mattress went together like a charm, fit the bed perfectly, and saved the day! I've recommended it to anyone I know who needs a way to put a "mattress in a box" on a standard bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: My regular wooden slats that came with the bed were cheap. One even split! I just placed this on top of the existing slats and now I have a solid platform. I would say be very careful measuring. I was a bit off but because I could place it on top of the existing slats it worked and I now have a solid platform.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: I took a chance and it worked!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant at first because some reviews complained about the sizing. I will say it's very sturdy and it fits in the Zenus king bed railing. It fits perfectly inside. The railing had some rubber grips to put on the trackings, so whatever you put down, it wont slide..if the grippers dont work for you, you can easily find something to put in so the metal to metal dont slide. Glad I bought both products!
customer_reviews.author: Hattie Johnson Polk

customer_reviews.title: Works great does not squeak!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! it was easy to put together, It doesn't squeak, and it supports my mattress not problem. We bought it because we were having issues with our memory foam mattress not being able to ventilate from the bottom causing it to sleep hot. this is what the manufacturer recommended and it does the trick for sure.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Groh

customer_reviews.title: Not for any bed n box mattress like Casper and I'm sure others! Ikea Malm
customer_reviews.text: This company knows damn well it can't be used for most if not all bed n box like Casper, Purple etc for just a slat. The slats are 5 inches apart and I'm not going to risk ruining a 1200 king on this. It MAY work with a IKEA MALM with some tweaking and its metal on the metal ridges and its short. So I would not get this for the IKEA MALM King. PRO - Easy to assemble CON - Decisive marketing and NO RETURNS
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: When the frame of our very expensive, fancy Italian bed bent on us, this bed frame came to the rescue! Assembly was quite easy. I thought the little grip strips that keep the mattress from sliding were a nice touch. And most importantly, it's been sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Maddi

customer_reviews.title: its great, but if you dont have a footboard
customer_reviews.text: its great, but if you dont have a footboard, you will have to rig a way to secure it at the head board so it does not slide. assembly was easy
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for our king size platform bed and it’s not standard king size. We had to attach two of the old wooden slats to the wooden bed frame to keep it from falling in. The frame sinks a little and we both roll towards the middle of the bed when laying in bed. It needs a support leg in the middle. It also makes an obnoxious haunted house squeaking floor sound any time you sit down or move in bed. The wooden slats we had before lasted 10 years before it started to squeak. I wish it was easier to return, I definitely would.
customer_reviews.author: Wifey

customer_reviews.title: Happy with everything!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions were simple and it came with a small Allen wrench ratchet that made it easy to assemble. Was perfect fit for our king size frame. No more dipping from wooden slats!! Shipped fast too overall great shopping experience!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Saved my bed!
customer_reviews.text: I was seconds away of throwing away my new fancy bed because the cheap wood slats keep broken every week due to my weight (6.5 245lbs) and specially the king size Tempur-pedic on top of them that weights a ton. And then this miracle happened that I found these metal structure on amazon. Happiest day in a long time. Assembled in 30 minutes or so with all the included tools (good ratchet) and OMG I have a new bed! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Axis Technologies

customer_reviews.title: Great deal upgraded away from the wooden slats
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together, love the sturdiness of it !! With the added weight of it on my old wooden slats I'll probably buy w additional support feet for my platform king size bed , but it's worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble. worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Super fast & easy to assemble. took less than 5 minutes to put together. It's sturdy & gives our bed frame much more stability. Way more supportive than the roller slats that came with our bed
customer_reviews.author: Skylar Aspen Ross

customer_reviews.title: Returned-sizinng off
customer_reviews.text: Pro: looks like it would be sturdy for my kids and pretty easy to assemble. Con: I bought this for my king zinus bed but to my surprise it was too big, about an inch off as another reviewer mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Ladylib12

customer_reviews.title: Easly assembly
customer_reviews.text: Bed mattress now at a reasonable height without the foundations (boxsprings) - no squeak at all - fit perfectly in my King size metal bed frame and happy I get to keep my head board. Arrived quickly with no damage, or scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Myost Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I thought but very easy to put together. The non-slip strips are not a great idea considering one must lay the mattress on top but the strips make that hard. Placement of the non-slip strips might be better situated on the outter frame. That way, people can place their mattress on the frame and then remove the paper backing.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this! Had a 7" bed foundation that just raised the bed too high to comfortably climb into (too high for my dog and cat too). This works out perfectly. I was hesitant at first to buy this because I read reviews that were problematic. But it appears that Zinus corrected all the problems that I read about. It was very easy to assemble and very sturdy. It even came with a ratchet allen wrench (which I didn't even know existed). The price was right too with free shipping. If I'm ever in need of another Bunkie board, I won't hesitate to purchase this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected! Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: This was better than expected! Very high quality, super easy to put together and very sturdy. They give extra parts, just In case something is missing. Very nice touch that they give you a ratcheting Allen wrench to put it all together. The pictures on the amazon listing are very accurate so I’m not adding any.
customer_reviews.author: Waly

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating install
customer_reviews.text: We got this in place of the wood slates we had on our king size bed. It was so heavy it would sink in the middle like crazy. With this it’s a little better but I should have gotten a box spring Instead. Also, Some of the horizontal slate bars wouldn’t fit into the notches. I’m not sure if the cut where they were supposed to be was off or the bar was slightly longer but it was very frustrating. I ended up having to remove the cushion outside of one of the notches for the bar to barely fit and I had to hammer is down. I must have gotten a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Almanza

customer_reviews.title: This board easily fit into our king size frame (not Zinus branded*) ...
customer_reviews.text: This board easily fit into our king size frame (not Zinus branded*) and provides excellent support for our memory foam mattress. We decided to purchase this product as traditional box springs made our bed too tall to get into and out of comfortably. This lowered the mattress to an acceptable height while feeling sturdy and providing support. This was easy to put together with two people and plenty of space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EASY
customer_reviews.text: I manage a furniture store and needed something to support a king-size mattress for an upholstered bed frame (because using a boxspring would have added way too much height). This works wonderfully! Took me 5 minutes to assemble, and the box included everything I needed. The added Thank You cards were sweet, and the tools they included were unique and helpful. Will definitely order again!
customer_reviews.author: C. Sperry

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my bed problems!
customer_reviews.text: I have an ikea malm king sized bed with a leesa mattress and me and the lady were both fighting over the center of the bed where it wouldnt sag. thos fixed it. so much better. I kept the wodden slatts in there underneath the new metal frame and it worked like a charm
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, does the job well!
customer_reviews.text: Assembled in about 10-15 minutes. The pieces are light weight but seem sturdy. The instructions were simple and it came with everything needed to assemble. It was just slightly smaller than the opening in my king size Ikea bed frame, but stayed in place once the mattress was on top.
customer_reviews.author: thiscaristooslow

customer_reviews.title: Life saver to replace wooden slats
customer_reviews.text: So we originally bought the wooden slats from IKEA for our king sized bed. After multiple times of the slats falling and scaring the s**t out of us while sleeping I knew there had to be a better solution. Thank God for this product. Easy to assemble. Took us maybe 20 mins and fit our IKEA king sized bed just fine. No more middle of the night wake up surprises. One thing I didn’t do was take off the sticky side of the slats so that the mattress could stick to it. I can see that being useful if you have a true platform bed but we didn’t need it. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The frame was too small for my standard king size bedframe, but I figured it was already out of the box, so I made adjustments to the bedframe to make it fit. The metal is not strong enough to hold my foam mattress and after a day it was bending in the middle and I had to replace it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Reichel

customer_reviews.title: First Rate All Around
customer_reviews.text: This bed board is very well designed, assembles easily, comes with clear instructions and the only tool needed to assemble it is supplied. And that tool is in particular a nice touch: instead of the standard allen wrench a RATCHETING allen wrench was supplied that made assembly that much faster. This replaces a set of wooden slats on a king sized bed, and is definitely an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jane H

customer_reviews.title: Easy one person assembly/ fits perfect on King 76” width bed
customer_reviews.text: Easy one person assembly. Great horizontal support fits on my 76” wide king frame with tempurpedic memory foam mattress/ no box spring so easier for my 12 year old dog to climb on without stairs. Used with vertical bunky boards (Zinus fabric covered slats) to reinforce support.
customer_reviews.author: Doggo luvr

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough for rails
customer_reviews.text: It's definately not big enough like the other reviews mentioned. It is no where close enough to wide enough to sit on the rails like in the picture. Theres like a 2" gap
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Good price, pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a bunkie board to replace our boxspring which made our bed too tall. This was easy to assemble with my husband and came with a little wrench. One of the bars was bent when we received it but I didn’t want to have to pack up all the pieces for one defective piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica R

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to eliminate my box springs to lower my bed. My king mattress is super heavy and I was worried about it sagging in the middle, but this Bunkie Board was perfect. it lowered my bed by 6 inches.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: It does not fit onto the zinus on the zinus Dachelle platform bed
customer_reviews.text: It does not fit onto the zinus Dachelle platform bed, contrary to what is stated in the product Q&As. Zinus did not let me return the item when I realized that I could not use the bunkie board above the Dachelle bed, because the one month return deadline was expired. I suggest that Zinus monitors the Q&As more closely, to make sure that potential customers find correct answers.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs I

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but Maybe Costly
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble. Because it only took us around 15 min to put them together. Quite thin, the sturdiness might be an issue for us in the future. And a little bit pricey considering the thinness. Still recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Helena

customer_reviews.title: Rejuvenated our mattress!
customer_reviews.text: This base has given our mattress new life! It has brought back the firmness my husband and I desire. We replace the wood slats that where bowing. It was super easy to put together and fit right inside out wooden frame. Totally worth every penny! The only thing we would have like is if it had a way to connect it to our bed frame.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Bizon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and use
customer_reviews.text: I put this together in about ten minutes. Secured it to the support with zip ties and then laid flooring on it vertically to create a dual layer of support for our mattress. Works pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: the king of pencils and sharpeners

customer_reviews.title: Don't use the sticky part

Compact packaging allows for tight interior spaces such as stairs and hallways. Available in twin, full, queen, and King, the Zinus quick lock Bunkie board will ensure long-lasting support and durability for your mattress. Another comfort innovation from Zinus.
